trans-unit.source: Contains the value of a settings property that can be loaded and stored by an instance of <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsBase"></xref>.
A class representation of the actual piece of profile data.
A <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty> instance describes a value stored within an instance of a SettingsPropertyValue object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue"></xref> class, based on supplied parameters.
> [!IMPORTANT] > Calling this method with untrusted data is a security risk.
Call this method only with trusted data.
For more information, see [Untrusted Data Security Risks](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=330378).
The <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty> object describes information about the value stored by the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue> object.
Specifies a <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.
Gets or sets whether the value of a <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object has been deserialized.
Deserialization of property values is only performed on demand.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the value of a <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object has been deserialized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets whether the value of a <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object has changed.
The IsDirty property indicates that the value stored by this class has changed.
The default is `false`.
The IsDirty property is set to `true` under the following conditions: 1.
The value contained in the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue> object is changed.
The value contained in the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue> object is accessed, and the value is not a string or a primitive type such as `int`, `float`, `real`, or `DateTime`.

When the value managed by a <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue> object is a complex type (for example an <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList>), there is no way for a <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue> object to detect when changes have been made.

As a result, the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue> object pessimistically assumes that a complex type is dirty once it has been accessed from the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue.PropertyValue%2A> property.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the value of a <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object has changed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the name of the property from the associated <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.
The name of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.
Gets the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object that describes the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the value of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.
The value of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.

When this value is set, the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue.IsDirty*> property is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> and <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue.UsingDefaultValue*> is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

When a value is first accessed from the PropertyValue property, and if the value was initially stored into the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue"></xref> object as a serialized representation using the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue.SerializedValue*> property, the PropertyValue property will trigger deserialization of the underlying value. As a side effect, the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue.Deserialized*> property will be set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
If this chain of events occurs in ASP.NET, and if an error occurs during the deserialization process, the error is logged using the health-monitoring feature of ASP.NET.
By default, this means that deserialization errors will show up in the Application Event Log when running under ASP.NET.
If this process occurs outside of ASP.NET, and if an error occurs during deserialization, the error is suppressed, and the remainder of the logic during deserialization occurs.

If there is no serialized value to deserialize when the deserialization is attempted, then <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue"></xref> object will instead attempt to return a default value if one was configured as defined on the associated <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> instance.

In this case, if the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.DefaultValue*> property was set to either <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, or to the string "[null]", then the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue"></xref> object will initialize the PropertyValue property to either <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> for reference types, or to the default value for the associated value type. On the other hand, if <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.DefaultValue*> property holds a valid object reference or string value (other than "[null]"), then the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.DefaultValue*> property is returned instead. If there is no serialized value to deserialize when the deserialization is attempted, and no default value was specified, then an empty string will be returned for string types. For all other types, a default instance will be returned by calling <xref:System.Activator.CreateInstance*> — for reference types this means an attempt will be made to create an object instance using the default constructor.
If this attempt fails, then <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> is returned.

While attempting to use the default value from the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.DefaultValue*> property, an error occurred. Either the attempt to convert <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.DefaultValue*> property to a valid type failed, or the resulting value was not compatible with the type defined by <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.PropertyType*>.
Gets or sets the serialized value of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.

If the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue> instance detects that the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue.PropertyValue%2A> property has changed since the last time the SerializedValue property was called, it will cause <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue.PropertyValue%2A> property to be converted to its serialized representation.

The specific serialization mechanism to be used is defined by the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.SerializeAs%2A> property on the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty> instance associated with the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue> instance.

The current supported serialization options are to convert the object to a string using a string type converter, serialize using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>, or perform binary serialization.
> [!NOTE] > The underlying serializers may throw exceptions during the serialization process.

The immediate caller code requires the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag> permission (one of the permissions available as part of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission>) to call either the getter or setter for this property.
This permission is enforced with a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction> enumeration value.
The serialized value of a <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.
The serialization options for the property indicated the use of a string type converter, but a type converter was not available.

Gets a Boolean value specifying whether the value of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValue"></xref> object is the default value as defined by the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.DefaultValue*> property value on the associated <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the value of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsProperty"></xref> object is the default value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
